post: David Bobb, BRI's President, was recently quoted in a NY Times article on America's 250th birthday celebration: Lets try to make the 250th a time for rediscovering those [principles of the Declaration of Independence] and what they mean for the next 250 years.  Read more in the article:  https://nyti.ms/4lcfEWo

Congratulations to Alitah Majeed-Hall, the Second Place winner of our MyImpact Challenge! Through One Word Reading, she has distributed over 3,700 childrens books to more than 1,400 families in 13 states. Her goal was to inspire a love of reading, boost academic achievement, and strengthen communities. Find out more about the project in this video!  https://bit.ly/3GzBEeP  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

eLuma delivers end-to-end student services for online special education and behavioral health to K-12 schools nationwide. They partner and consult with school districts to empower students to access their education, achieve their potential, and know their rights. We are grateful for their support of our Civics for Everyone initiative. Learn more about the initiative and how you can support the Institute!  https://bit.ly/4jBYuQp

Congratulations to Arthur Hu, Caleb Kurlantzick, and Saniya Yamin, the First Place winners of our MyImpact Challenge! Their project, PIVOT, is a policy think tank made up of teenagers from 30 states and 11 countries. It works to give youth a platform to share their ideas with peers, community leaders, and legislators. Find out more about the project in this video!  https://bit.ly/3GzBEeP  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Congratulations to William Mar, winner of the $10,000 National Grand Prize in our MyImpact Challenge! William's project, Reach Through Rackets, brings accessible tennis programming to children with disabilities in Austin, Texas. His initiative embodies the constitutional principles of liberty and equality that are at the heart of our contest. Learn more about the contest and William's project through this video!  https://bit.ly/3GzBEeP  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Today, we celebrate the legacy of American freedom and encourage you to rediscover the foundations of American independence with our curated Independence Day playlist! Dive into primary sources and thought-provoking essays that bring the spirit of 1776 to life.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #IndependenceDay  #4thofJuly  #AmericanHistory  https://bit.ly/3CQQYy5

How well do you know your Independence Day history? Take our July 4th quiz that appeared in today's Atlanta Journal-Constitution Opinion section:  https://bit.ly/45Vjlem  #BillofRightsInstitute  #IndependenceDay  #4thofJuly  #AmericanHistory

The Declaration of Independence is more than just a document, it's an "expression of the American mind" according to Thomas Jefferson. Rooted in John Locke's philosophy itt asserted that legitimate government stems from the consent of the governed. Learn more about how and why we celebrate this uniquely American holiday through our "Why Do we Celebrate the Fourth of July?" podcast  https://bit.ly/3TpJquC  #fourthofjuly  #AmericanHistory  #BRI

Are you planning summer travel? Did you know you can support BRI while you travel? Through our partnership with Traveling to Give, every travel purchase you make can help support our civic mission. Solutionz Book your new flight, rental car, or hotel stay through our website and give back to the Institute!  https://bit.ly/43XWUUk

Recently, some inspiring high school students from Queens, NY, came together to celebrate civic engagement, creativity, and community service at the New York City MyImpact Challenge Fair, which was hosted by students for students. Based on the Bill of Rights Institutes national MyImpact Challenge, this event gave young changemakers the chance to showcase their incredible service projects, compete for monetary prizes, and inspire their peers to become leaders in their community. Watch the video today and look out for the announcement of the National Contest winner on July 7th!  https://bit.ly/3I2AE3o
